sections.heading: What is Tara-conditional?
sections.content:
たら-form (tara-conditional) expresses "if/when" conditions, especially for:

Specific/completed conditions Discoveries and realizations Past hypotheticals Suggestions

食べたら (tabetara) - if/when (you) eat 書いたら (kaitara) - if/when (you) write したら (shitara) - if/when (you) do

sections.heading: How to Form Tara
sections.content:
Simple rule: Take ta-form, add ら

Ta-form → Tara-form 食べた → 食べたら 行った → 行ったら した → したら

children.heading: Ichidan Verbs
children.content: 食べる → 食べた → 食べたら (if eat) 見る → 見た → 見たら (if see) 寝る → 寝た → 寝たら (if sleep) 起きる → 起きた → 起きたら (if wake up)

children.heading: Godan Verbs
children.content: 書く → 書いた → 書いたら (if write) 読む → 読んだ → 読んだら (if read) 話す → 話した → 話したら (if speak) 買う → 買った → 買ったら (if buy) 待つ → 待った → 待ったら (if wait) 遊ぶ → 遊んだ → 遊んだら (if play) 帰る → 帰った → 帰ったら (if return) 泳ぐ → 泳いだ → 泳いだら (if swim)

children.heading: Irregular Verbs
children.content: する → した → したら (if do) 来る → 来た → 来たら (きたら, kitara) (if come)

sections.heading: Complete Conjugation Chart
sections.content: | Dictionary | Ta-form | Tara-form | Meaning | | ---------- | ------- | --------- | -------- | | 書く | 書いた | 書いたら | if write | | 読む | 読んだ | 読んだら | if read | | 話す | 話した | 話したら | if speak | | 買う | 買った | 買ったら | if buy | | 食べる | 食べた | 食べたら | if eat | | 見る | 見た | 見たら | if see | | する | した | したら | if do | | 来る | 来た | 来たら | if come |

sections.heading: Negative Tara
sections.content:
Use なかったら :

食べる → 食べなかった → 食べなかったら (if don't eat) 行く → 行かなかった → 行かなかったら (if don't go) する → しなかった → しなかったら (if don't do)

children.heading: 1. Specific Completed Conditions
children.content: 家に帰ったら、電話してね "When you get home, call me" (after completing the action of going home) 宿題が終わったら、遊ぼう "When homework is finished, let's play" 春になったら、桜が咲く "When spring comes, the cherry blossoms bloom"

children.heading: 2. Discoveries/Surprises
children.content: 家に帰ったら、誰もいなかった "When I got home, no one was there" (unexpected discovery) 開けてみたら、空だった "When I opened it, it was empty" 聞いてみたら、違っていた "When I asked, it was different"

children.heading: 3. Hypothetical/Suggestions
children.content: 明日雨だったら、行かない "If it rains tomorrow, I won't go" 時間があったら、映画を見よう "If we have time, let's watch a movie" お金があったら、何を買う？ "If you had money, what would you buy?"

children.heading: 4. Past Hypotheticals
children.content: もっと勉強したら、合格できたのに "If I had studied more, I could have passed" 早く起きたら、間に合ったのに "If I had woken up early, I would have made it"

sections.heading: Tara vs Ba Comparison
sections.content: | Tara (たら) | Ba (ば) | | ------------------ | ------------------- | | Specific condition | General condition | | After completion | Natural consequence | | Discoveries | Hypotheticals | | Past hypotheticals | General rules | | More casual | More formal |

children.heading: Examples
children.content:
Tara: 家に帰ったら、電話する "When I get home, I'll call" (specific time, after arriving) Ba: 家に帰れば、電話する "If I go home, I'll call" (general condition)

Tara: 食べたら、美味しかった "When I ate it, it was delicious" (discovery after trying) Ba: 食べれば、美味しい "If you eat it, it's delicious" (general truth)

children.heading: ～たらどう？ (How about...?)
children.content: 休んだらどう？ "How about taking a rest?" 医者に行ったらどう？ "How about going to the doctor?" もう一度やってみたらどう？ "How about trying one more time?"

children.heading: ～たらいい (Should/Would be good if)
children.content: 早く寝たらいい "You should sleep early" もっと練習したらいい "You should practice more" 質問したらいいよ "You should ask"

children.heading: ～たら、～た (When..., then...)
children.content: 家に帰ったら、すぐ寝た "When I got home, I immediately slept" 食べたら、満足した "When I ate, I was satisfied" 開けたら、驚いた "When I opened it, I was surprised"

children.heading: い-adjectives
children.content: 高い → 高かった → 高かったら (if expensive) 大きい → 大きかった → 大きかったら (if big) おいしい → おいしかった → おいしかったら (if delicious)

children.heading: な-adjectives
children.content: 静か → 静かだった → 静かだったら (if quiet) 便利 → 便利だった → 便利だったら (if convenient)

children.heading: Example 1: Making Plans
children.content: A: 明日どうする？ "What are we doing tomorrow?" B: 天気が良かったら、ピクニックに行こう "If the weather is good, let's go on a picnic" A: 雨だったら？ "If it rains?" B: 映画でも見よう "Let's watch a movie or something"

children.heading: Example 2: Giving Advice
children.content: A: 頭が痛い "I have a headache" B: 薬を飲んだらどう？ "How about taking medicine?" A: もう飲んだ "I already took some" B: じゃあ、休んだらいいよ "Then you should rest"

children.heading: Example 3: Past Experience
children.content: A: 昨日どうだった？ "How was yesterday?" B: 家に帰ったら、友達が来ていた "When I got home, my friend was there" A: 驚いた？ "Were you surprised?" B: うん、びっくりした "Yeah, I was shocked"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using Ba for Discoveries
children.content: Less natural: 開けば、空だった ❌ Natural: 開けたら、空だった ✓ "When I opened it, it was empty"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using Tara for General Truths
children.content: Less natural: 春になったら、暖かくなる Natural: 春になれば、暖かくなる ✓ "When spring comes, it gets warm"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong Ta-form Base
children.content: Wrong: 食べるたら ❌ Right: 食べたら ✓ Wrong: 行くたら ❌ Right: 行ったら ✓

sections.heading: When to Use Tara
sections.content:
Use TARA for:

Sequential events After completing action Discoveries/surprises Specific conditions Suggestions (～たらどう) Past hypotheticals

Use BA for:

General conditions Natural consequences Formal situations General truths

children.heading: Suggestions
children.content: 少し休んだらどう？ "How about resting a bit?" コーヒーでも飲んだら？ "How about having some coffee?" 先生に聞いてみたらどう？ "How about trying to ask the teacher?"

children.heading: Discoveries
children.content: ドアを開けたら、猫がいた "When I opened the door, there was a cat" 財布を見たら、お金がなかった "When I looked at my wallet, there was no money" 電話したら、留守だった "When I called, they were out"

children.heading: Future Plans
children.content: 卒業したら、就職する "When I graduate, I'll get a job" お金が貯まったら、旅行する "When I save money, I'll travel" 春になったら、引っ越す "When spring comes, I'll move"

sections.heading: Polite Form
sections.content:
Tara itself doesn't conjugate, but the result clause does:

家に帰ったら、電話します "When I get home, I'll call" (polite) 食べたら、美味しかったです "When I ate it, it was delicious" (polite)

sections.heading: Practice Sentences
sections.content: 雨が降ったら、中止です "If it rains, it's cancelled" 時間があったら、来てください "If you have time, please come" 分からなかったら、聞いてください "If you don't understand, please ask" 終わったら、連絡してね "When you finish, contact me" 見つかったら、教えて "If you find it, let me know" 暇だったら、遊ぼう "If you're free, let's hang out" 良かったら、一緒にどうですか？ "If you'd like, how about together?" もし行けなかったら、ごめん "If I can't go, sorry"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Tara = ta-form + ら ✓ Specific/completed conditions ✓ Discoveries and surprises ✓ Sequential events ✓ Suggestions (～たらどう) ✓ Past hypotheticals ✓ More casual than ba ✓ Use after action completion ✓ Perfect for "when... then..." patterns

Master tara-conditional - essential for natural conditions!
